info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 4 at 4:21AM CDT until July 4 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Kimble County in west central Texas... South Central Menard County in west central Texas...
* Until 730 AM CDT.
* At 421 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yates Crossing, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773 and The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 7:30 AM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 7:30 AM CDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 7:30 AM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 7:30 AM CDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
